topic.title: HPE Helion OpenStack 2.0: Disabling Backup/Restore before Deployment

section.title: Disable backup/restore jobs creation completely:
section.p: To disable Freezer's deployment, comment out the following lines in the following files: This action is required even if you already removed Freezer lines from your model (control_plane.yml).

body.section:
Disable backup/restore jobs creation completely:
It is possible to continue deploying Freezer and prevent the lifecycle manager from creating automatic backup jobs.
By default, the lifecycle manager deployment automatically creates jobs for the backup and restore of the following:
Deployer/Lifecycle-manager node
MySQL database
Swift rings You can disable the creation of those jobs while launching the deployment process, as follows:ansible-playbook -i hosts/verb_hosts site.yml -e '{ "freezer_backup_jobs_upload": false }' -e '{ "freezer_restore_jobs_upload": false }'
When using those options, the Freezer infrastructure will still be deployed but will not execute any backups.

section.title: Disable the backup/restore jobs of a specific service:
section.p: If some fine tuning is required, you can edit the following file before running the Configuration Processor and ready deployment scripts: ~/helion/hos/ansible/_freezer_manage_jobs.yml

You can combine the following instructions to disable the creation of multiple service jobs.
To disable the deployer's jobs, comment-out all localhost paragraphs, as follows: ---
- hosts: FRE-AGN roles: - freezer-jobs tasks: - include: roles/freezer-jobs/tasks/_pre_manage_jobs.yml when: freezer_backup_jobs_upload or freezer_restore_jobs_upload - include: roles/freezer-jobs/tasks/_deploy_ssh_key.yml serial: "{{ freezer_serialization | default(3) | int }}"

section.title: Disable the creation of one specific job:
section.p: If some fine tuning is required, you can edit the following file before running the Configuration Processor and ready deployment scripts:~/helion/hos/ansible/_freezer_manage_jobs.yml

The following example shows how to disable Swift jobs only. You can do this, for example, to ensure no space is used in Swift to store backups (in that case, be sure to have some SSH backups configured).---
- hosts: FRE-AGN roles: - freezer-jobs tasks: - include: roles/freezer-jobs/tasks/_pre_manage_jobs.yml when: freezer_backup_jobs_upload or freezer_restore_jobs_upload - include: roles/freezer-jobs/tasks/_deploy_ssh_key.yml serial: "{{ freezer_serialization | default(3) | int }}"
